Abstract

This project aims to analyze anime genre distributions, popularity trends, and personal viewing patterns through an interactive dashboard. By leveraging data from MyAnimeList and applying statistical analysis techniques, we‚Äôll identify patterns in genre evolution and discover underrated anime that match user preferences.

Status: This project is in the planning phase. Detailed findings and visualizations will be added as work progresses.

Research Questions

  1. How do anime genre distributions change over time?
  2. What patterns exist in the relationship between genre, popularity, and ratings?
  3. Can we identify underrated anime before they gain mainstream recognition?
  4. How do personal viewing patterns correlate with broader genre trends?

Methodology

Data Collection

  • Source: MyAnimeList API (Jikan)
  • Scope: Anime metadata, ratings, genres, popularity metrics
  • Time Range: Historical data spanning multiple years

Analysis Approach

  • Statistical clustering to identify genre patterns
  • Time-series analysis of popularity trends
  • Correlation analysis between ratings and popularity
  • Personal viewing pattern analysis

Tools & Techniques

  • Python for data processing
  • Pandas for data manipulation
  • Matplotlib/Seaborn for visualization
  • Streamlit for interactive dashboard

Expected Outcomes

Deliverables

  1. Interactive Dashboard: Streamlit-based visualization tool
  2. Genre Heatmaps: Visual representation of genre popularity over time
  3. Recommendation Engine: Data-driven anime suggestions
  4. Research Report: Findings and insights from the analysis

Impact

  • Help anime fans discover hidden gems
  • Provide insights into anime industry trends
  • Enable data-driven content recommendations

Technical Challenges

To be documented as the project progresses

What I‚Äôll Learn

  • Advanced data visualization techniques
  • API integration and data pipeline design
  • Statistical analysis and pattern recognition
  • Interactive dashboard development with Streamlit
  • Anime industry trends and viewer behavior patterns

Timeline

Appendix

Dataset Information

  • Primary Source: MyAnimeList via Jikan API
  • Data Points: Genre, rating, popularity, air date, studio, etc.
  • Sample Size: To be determined
